channel.title: VPS Hosting a server
channel.description:
Okay, well I'm preparing to buy a VPS from [url=http://vpsland.com]This site[/url] and was wondering what kind of VPS I should get. My server has around 20 on during the day but it's picking up. It's a DSPK base with things I personally added as well as things I took from other servers such as memleak fixes. I'm not the best with hosting, I just want to know what kind of VPS you would recommend for such a server. Also if you have a different host that is better let me know.
Thanks.

item.title: VPS Hosting a server
item.dc:creator: @fleminmj01 fleminmj01
item.description:
@fleminmj01 wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:5, topic:407511”][quote author=LeetYO link=topic=508800.msg3691334#msg3691334 date=1312148488]

Well from my knowledge, 100MB RAM hold 1 player. I had a VPS from HostGator that had 384MB RAM and crashed when the third player logged in because of no memory. So i’d advised to get level 5 or 6 since your server is growing.

So not true.

Of course it’s true, how could I make it up? I saw the run log spamming with not enough memory and shit.

I have hosted over 30 players on a 512mb ram. Your source is just unstable as fuck.
[/quote]
That’s why I switched. What source are you using?[/quote]

HAHAHA 100mb per person… are you joking so you want him to pay $140 a month for a vps lol

you a joke man sort it out idk what vps u got but lol 1gb RAM will hold way more than his server even has atm

So not true.

Read full topic

item.title: VPS Hosting a server
item.dc:creator: @purestmage74 purestmage74
item.description:
@purestmage74 wrote:

Note:

Nlvl is horrible…

Read this topic for more information:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,510930.html

item.title: VPS Hosting a server
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

imsuperman05:

Well from my knowledge, 100MB RAM hold 1 player. I had a VPS from HostGator that had 384MB RAM and crashed when the third player logged in because of no memory. So i’d advised to get level 5 or 6 since your server is growing.

I have held 100-150 people within a 100 tile radius of each other on a vps with 512MB RAM, my god man, fix your memory leaks.

Read full topic

item.title: VPS Hosting a server
item.dc:creator: @purestmage74 purestmage74
item.description:
@purestmage74 wrote:

What you really need to aim for is stability fixes within your source. Nlvl is excellent, I know the owner.

NLVL is horrible, what are you talking about?

Read full topic

item.title: VPS Hosting a server
item.dc:creator: @pildurass pildurass
item.description:
@pildurass wrote:

Use swvps they are the best on the source im using i hosted up to 30 players zero lagg and it only took up 2 percent of the cpu =p pretty boss if u ask me, i am using their first plan which costs me 16 dollars a month, also i got my server in 6 hours ( which is super fast) and u can use remote connection desktop to connect to it. It has everything i could ask for =p

Read full topic

item.title: VPS Hosting a server
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

Thanks. I’m okay with Java, but when it comes to system resources required I’m pretty helpless.

Read full topic

item.title: VPS Hosting a server
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

Well, my friend has been hosting it on a 4g RAM computer and it holds 20 just fine, even when He’s playing minecraft. Like I said, I stabilized it a bit more from the original DSPK, so it could take more or less.

Read full topic

item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

imsuperman05:

Well from my knowledge, 100MB RAM hold 1 player. I had a VPS from HostGator that had 384MB RAM and crashed when the third player logged in because of no memory. So i’d advised to get level 5 or 6 since your server is growing.

Damn. I’m thinking of using Next Level Hosting, I’ve heard allot about them. Thanks for the 100mb tip, Runescape seems more intense to host than Minecraft.
